Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model: a. Extrude the sketch by 0.75 units in the normal direction. b. Scale the sketch by 0.75. Part 2 Create a three-dimensional geometric shape with a central hole, resembling a hexagonal prism. 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector of 0.09, 0.0459, 0.0. 2. Draw the sketch for the first face: a. Create line_1 from (0.0, 0.1645) to (0.285, 0.0). b. Create line_2 from (0.285, 0.0) to (0.57, 0.1645). c. Create line_3 from (0.57, 0.1645) to (0.57, 0.4936). d. Create line_4 from (0.57, 0.4936) to (0.285, 0.6582). e. Create line_5 from (0.285, 0.6582) to (0.0, 0.4936). f. Create line_6 from (0.0, 0.4936) to (0.0, 0.1645). g. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model: a. Extrude the sketch by 0.3 units in the normal direction. b. Scale the sketch by 0.6582. c. Integrate the part by joining with the preceding model for the final shape. The final shape will be a slightly tapered cylindrical object, with a larger top and a slightly smaller bottom, with a centered hexagonal opening, resembling a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered shape, with the top being slightly wider than the bottom.</description>

Finally, we will extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model. - Scale the sketch by 0.75 - Extrude the scaled sketch by the given "extrude_depth_towards_normal" value **Part Dimensions:** - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.1842 - Height: 0.75</description>
